history.content: When I took CS 70 in Fall 2014, Sahai gave people the option to do an oral exam for some EC. For us we were allowed to form groups of 2, and so it was 2 people and one GSI in a room. The difficulty ranged from basic (definition level) to difficult (requires fair around of thinking plus trying out small examples and patterns to get intuition). Note that he scored it like a grad prelim because those  were the only the standards he knew. By these it is very difficult to achieve full points, the average was around a 7 / 10. I would say treat these like an interview in that you really should show all your thinking out loud, it can help for partial credit if you don't completely hit the mark but come close.
If any of you have taken an oral exam, can someone please explain what they're like, and if possible specifically what 170 oral exams are like?
history.subject: Oral Exams
